Title: GB-Trent City Council: Rivington Crescent Driveway Planting Softworks.
Description: The site comprises a number of resident’s front gardens in Withington Road, Fegg Hayes Road, Rivington Crescent, Johnson Place, Eccleston Place, Bretherton Place, Chorley Avenue, Oversley Avenue, Farington Place, Biddulph Road and Oakley Place in Fegg Hayes, Stoke-on-Trent. This residential area is a mix of council and privately owned ex-council properties. The council owned properties form part of an estate wide improvement programme, which includes refurbishment works to the housing stock and improvements to the external areas of the estate, including provision of paths and driveways to lessen the impact of on-road parking. Within the site areas comprising this contract new driveways and paths have already been constructed by another contractor (who has now left site) having laid the unpaved areas of the front gardens to grass. The proposed work is aimed at providing the residents with a planted area to compliment the new hard landscaping and provide an attractive border at the entrance to their properties.
Additional Text:
The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement, and the contract will be awarded on the basis of the most economically advantageous tender.Tender Title:-  Rivington Crescent Driveway Planting softworks *

Suppliers Instructions How to Tender

1. Register your company on the IEWM eTendering portal (this is only 
    required once)

     - Browse to the eSourcing Portal: www.iewm.bravosolution.co.uk/sotandstaffordshireauthorities 
     - Click the "Click here to register" link
     - Accept the terms and conditions and click "continue"
     - Enter your correct business and user details
     - Note the username you chose and click "Save" when complete
     - You will shortly receive an email with your unique password (please keep 
        this secure)

2. Responding to the tender
     - Login to the portal with your username/password
     - Click the "Open Access ITTs" link. (These are ITTs open to any registered 
       supplier)
     - Click on the relevant ITT to access the content.
     - Click the "Express Interest" button in the "Actions" box on the left-hand side 
       of the page.
     - This will move the ITT into your "My ITTs" page. (This is a secure area 
        reserved for your projects only)
     - Click on the ITT code, you can now access any attachments by clicking the 
       "Settings and Buyer Attachments" in the "Actions" box
-Click  my response to see all other questions.

     - You can now choose to "Reply" or "Reject" (please give a reason if rejecting)
     - You can now use the 'Messages' function to communicate with the buyer 
        and seek any clarification
     - Note the deadline for completion, then follow the onscreen instructions to 
       complete the ITT
- There may be a mixture of online & offline actions for you to perform (there 
   is detailed online help available)

If you require any further assistance use the online help, or the BravoSolution help desk is available Mon - Fri (8am - 6pm) on: - eMail: help@bravosolution.co.uk

Title: Cannon Hall Re-Development Works - Provision of Landscape Works (Contract 3)
Description: Barnsley Metropolitan Borough Council (the Council) is looking to appoint a contractor to undertake a package of landscape improvements works throughout much of the Listed Cannon Hall Park and Gardens, including paths, site furniture, signage, planting and drainage. The primary aims are to enhance the landscape quality of the publicly assessable greenspace, to preserve and interpret its historical importance, to make the site physically more accessible, and to enhance the relationship between the public park and Cannon Hall Museum. This contract will be Contract 3 of a total of 3 works packages to be commissioned in the re-development of the Cannon Hall Parks and Gardens. This contract is the 3rd package of work to be commissioned as part of a redevelopment project using Heritage Lottery Funding.  Further information on the project is available free of charge at www.yortender.co.uk.

Title: Tender for restocking of trees at Betty's Wood, St Ives Estate, Bingley
Description: The Council's long term aspiration is to "create high quality sustainable woodlands that meet the needs of the people and the natural environment". Betty's Wood makes up a portion of the larger Bell Bank Wood which is contained within the St Ives Estate to the west of Bingley. A stand of mainly larch plus other conifer species was planted in the 1940s making up what became affectionately known as Betty's Wood. However, in 2017 the larch and sweet chestnut was felled following an outbreak of Phytophthora ramorum and the issuing of a Statutory Plant Health Notice. Restocking is a condition of the felling licence issued as part of EWGS case ref. 36627.

Title: The Design and Layout, Supply and Installation of Overflow Car Parking Surfacing and Ancillary items at Buckley Hill Playing Fields Netherton
Description:
This Procurement is for the Design & Layout,Supply and Installation of overflow car parking surfacing and anciallry items at Buckley Hill Playing fields, Netherton 

All items must have a minimum gurantee of 15 Years.

Requirements

Overflow car parking at Buckley Hill Playing Fields
Overflow car parking is required at the above site to maximise the number of private light vehicles/ cars able to park on site during peak times of football play at the weekened. The site is not heavily used during the week.

The layout of the overflow should be broadly in line with the attached outline plan (which was used to seek Planning Permission). The overflow should accommodate circa 135 additional spaces measuring 2.4x4.8M, with 6m between rows to allow suitable access and turning circles etc. 6Nr larger disabled bays should be allowed for within the design (location to be agreed)

-	Install circa 64 parking spaces to the right of the main entrance. The area is predominately even and flat and has well established grass growth across most of the area.  There are some gentle undulations on site but these ar not deemed a concern.  
 
-	Create circa 109 parking spaces in the second area as show on the plan (circa 74 being grass reinforced mesh, the remainder being marking out of the tarmac surfacing. This area needs work to get ground ready for the mesh surfacing to perform well.  This includes clearing,  perhaps installing a drainage layer, topping with sandy soils to an 200mm depth and turfed with an amenity grass.  Most of this second area to the left is currently in the same good condition as the area to the right.


The material for extended surfacing should be a heavy mesh style plastic reinforment, such as SureGreen GR14 or similar approved. 

Car parking spaces markers should also be included. An existing area of hard standing shall also be marked out to formalise parking at this area too.

Works are to include for all preliminary ground works to level surface areas, lay the material, and establish grass sward to four full cuts. Protective fencing shall be required to protect the existing hedging on Buckley Hill, and to prevent access to the working area of construction, both during construction, and through the establishment period.

Consideration shall also be given to the junction between the grass matting overflow and the existing hard surfaced areas.

Works are to commence as soon as practicable in order to establish the grass sward to a point of opening use of the overflow no later than 30th October

3SH.  The former golf club is accessed from Ring Road, LS10 3TN.

Title: PC05368 - Norfolk Park Play and Access Improvements
Description:
The project incorporates improvements and renovation to the existing playground areas within Norfolk Park; consisting of an under 8s area and a Woodland playground (over 8s). Both areas are located near to the Centre in the Park building, adjacent to the Guildford Avenue entrance and car park.
Works to the under 8s area will consist of the removal of existing play equipment, existing surfacing and a small retaining structure, the installation of replacement equipment and associated surfacing, earthworks, the construction of a Bitmac scooter track and the provision of new picnic tables and benches.
Works to the Woodland playground (over 8s) will comprise the refurbishment of the main climbing unit, the removal of play equipment and the installation of new play equipment and associated surfacing. A new accessible area will be created through remodelling existing levels and building a new low retaining wall. 
New benches, litter bins and picnic tables will also be installed, whilst part of the existing fencing will be removed and replaced by a new boundary wall.
Additional Text: The PQQ and draft Tender Information is now available to download by logging into YORtender and searching for the job reference number SHEFCC001-DN289295-24217948.   The PQQ's are to be returned electronically. Tenderers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading the documents to ensure that the submission deadline is met. The PQQ is to be submitted via https://www.yortender.co.uk/procontract/user.nsf to be received not later than 5pm on Monday 14 August 2017.

Title: GB-Trent: civil engineering and landscape improvements

Stoke-on-Trent City Council has been successful with a Round 2 Heritage Lottery Fund (HLF) grant application ('Parks for People' programme) for the comprehensive restoration of historic Hanley Park (including its Cauldon Grounds 'annex'). 
      
      The Council is seeking to commission an appropriate contractor to commence the third works package of the restoration project, namely to carry out civil engineering and landscape improvements at Hanley Park, including lake edge and pond / rockery repairs, footpath construction and resurfacing, drainage, and ornamental planting. The Council is therefore undertaking a pre-qualification exercise (PQQ) as a precursor to inviting tenders from appropriate contractors.

Title: Improvements to Harrison Close Play Area
Description:
The Borough Council of Newcastle-under-Lyme working on behalf of Audley Parish Council is seeking to procure the services of contractor linked to the purchase/supply and installation of various pieces of playground equipment.
This procurement has been divided into two lots and potential contractors may bid for either or both lots.
Lot 1 is for supply and installation of equipment that have been chosen by local children as part of a recent consultation. The types of equipment in LOT 1 can be bought from a number of playground equipment suppliers with a specification accompanying this notice.
Lot 2 is for the supply and installation of specific items of playground equipment that have been chosen by local children. The type of equipment in LOT 2 is specific (with the exception of the frame for the single swing) and there is no option to substitute these items of equipment. Details of the requirements and supplier can be found in the specification accompanying this notice
